definition: to open (a door)/to open up (for development)/to dispel/to refute/to repudiate

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to open up/to set up/to establish
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to split heaven and earth apart (idiom); refers to the Pangu 盤古|盘古[Pan2 gu3] creation myth
lit. to open a room/fig. to settle in a quiet room/behind closed doors

sentences.english: His suggestion that Jiulong city must be a commercial port was strategic insight.
sentences.chinese: 提出了闢九龍爲商埠等有戰略眼光的建議。

sentences.english: Rachel's servant Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.
sentences.chinese: 拉結的使女闢拉又懷孕，給雅各生了第二個兒子。

sentences.english: In the palace, Izurieta set up a war room in the President’s office.
sentences.chinese: 國宮內，伊蘇列塔在總統辦公室裏特闢了一個作戰室。

sentences.english: And Bilhah Rachel's maid conceived again, and bare Jacob a second son.
sentences.chinese: 拉結的使女闢拉又懷孕，給雅各生了第二個兒子。

sentences.english: The Twelve begin constructing settlements in preparation for new life.
sentences.chinese: 十二使徒開疆闢地，爲新的生命做準備。

sentences.english: And Bilhah conceived, and bare Jacob a son.
sentences.chinese: 闢拉就懷孕，給雅各生了一個兒子。

sentences.english: Mo of the very evil people in the dead, then why not for patients who can be provided also?
sentences.chinese: 使人之所惡莫甚於死者，則凡可以闢患者何不爲也？

sentences.english: Barkis Bittern : Can a heart still break after it's stopped beating?
sentences.chinese: 茸心停止俯跳動掛了闢以顏後還會痛麼？

sentences.english: If what people hate cannot go beyond death, they will take all means, however wicked, in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 使人之所惡莫甚於死者，則凡可以闢患者何不爲也？

sentences.english: Shaoxing Yongfeng Cloth Co. , Ltd. is a private enterprise, setting up a border shopping window at Guangxi Dongxing Light Textile City.
sentences.chinese: 該公司繫個私企業，在廣西東興輕紡城闢有邊貿窗口。

sentences.english: In the palace, Izurieta set up a war room in the President's office.
sentences.chinese: 國宮內，伊蘇列塔在總統辦公室裏特闢了一個作戰室。

sentences.english: There are four archways at the bottom, which are interlinked with streets.
sentences.chinese: 閣的底層四面闢有拱門，與街道相通。

sentences.english: Visual downstairs to the provision of the South arch openings, recessed door was half-moon .
sentences.chinese: 鐘鼓樓下南向闢拱券門洞，門楣凹進呈半月形。

sentences.english: "Performance management" monarch new fields and cadres management is a new branch flowers.
sentences.chinese: “績效管理”闢幹部管理新領域，現獨秀新花。

definition: to open up/to set up/to establish
old anecdote/stories passed on from former times
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)
to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
to plan to/to draft (a plan)/to imitate/to assess/to compare/pseudo-
